infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a kitchen. An usual one.

 [if c_0 is locked]A locked[else if c_0 is open]An open[otherwise]A closed[end if] fridge is in the corner.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The fridge contains [a list of things in the c_0].[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] Were you looking for an oven? Because look over there, it's an oven.[if oven_0 is open and there is something in the oven_0] The oven contains [a list of things in the oven_0].[end if][if oven_0 is open and the oven_0 contains nothing] What a letdown! The oven is empty![end if] You can make out a table. [if there is something on the s_0]You see [a list of things on the s_0] on the table.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0]But the thing is empty, unfortunately.[end if] You can make out a counter. I guess it's true what they say, if you're looking for a counter, go to TextWorld. The counter is vast.[if there is something on the s_1] On the counter you can make out [a list of things on the s_1].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1] But the thing hasn't got anything on it. Aw, and here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if] Look out! It's a- oh, never mind, it's just a stove. The stove is conventional.[if there is something on the stove_0] On the stove you make out [a list of things on the stove_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the stove_0] Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though.[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] frosted-glass door leading south. You need an exit without a door? You should try going east. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is not blocked by one.

infos.name: corridor
infos.desc:
You arrive in a corridor. An usual one. You can barely contain your excitement.



 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] screen door leading east. You need an exit without a door? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is not blocked by one. You need an exit without a door? You should try going west.

infos.name: bedroom
infos.desc:
Guess what, you are in a place we're calling a bedroom.

 Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a bed. The bed is large.[if there is something on the s_3] On the bed you can make out [a list of things on the s_3].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3] But there isn't a thing on it. Silly bed, silly, empty, good for nothing bed.[end if]

There is an exit to the south. There is an exit to the west.

infos.name: livingroom
infos.desc:
You're now in the livingroom.

 You see a sofa. [if there is something on the s_4]On the sofa you can see [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4]Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though.[end if]

There is an exit to the east. You need an exit without a door? You should try going south.

infos.name: backyard
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a backyard. An ordinary kind of place.

 Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a patio table. [if there is something on the s_6]On the patio table you can make out [a list of things on the s_6].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_6]The patio table appears to be empty.[end if] You see a patio chair. The patio chair is stylish.[if there is something on the s_8] On the patio chair you see [a list of things on the s_8].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_8] However, the patio chair, like an empty patio chair, has nothing on it.[end if] You see a BBQ.[if toaster_0 is open and there is something in the toaster_0] The BBQ contains [a list of things in the toaster_0].[end if][if toaster_0 is open and the toaster_0 contains nothing] What a letdown! The BBQ is empty![end if]

 There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] wooden door leading east. There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] screen door leading west. There is an exit to the north.

infos.name: shed
infos.desc:
You arrive in a shed. An ordinary kind of place.

 You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a toolbox.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The toolbox contains [a list of things in the c_1]. You shudder, but continue examining the room.[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] The toolbox is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You can make out a workbench. [if there is something on the s_5]On the workbench you can make out [a list of things on the s_5].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_5]However, the workbench, like an empty workbench, has nothing on it.[end if]

 There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] wooden door leading west.

infos.name: bathroom
infos.desc:
Well, here we are in a bathroom.

 You can make out a toilet. [if there is something on the s_7]On the toilet you make out [a list of things on the s_7].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_7]Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it.[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is not blocked by one.

infos.name: pantry
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a pantry. An usual kind of place.

 You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a shelf. The shelf is wooden.[if there is something on the s_2] On the shelf you see [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2] Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it.[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] frosted-glass door leading north.

infos.name: garden
infos.desc:
You arrive in a garden. A typical one. You start to take note of what's in the room.



There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, there is no door.

infos.name: frosted-glass door
infos.desc: It is what it is, a [noun]. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: screen door
infos.desc: The [noun] looks manageable. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: wooden door
infos.desc: It is what it is, a [noun]. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to crack open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: fridge
infos.desc: The [noun] looks grand. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to bash open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: toolbox
infos.desc: The [noun] looks stuffy. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: cookbook
infos.desc:
You open the copy of 'Cooking: A Modern Approach (3rd Ed.)' and start reading:

Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
green bell pepper
  orange bell pepper
  yellow potato

Directions:
dice the green bell pepper
  fry the green bell pepper
  dice the orange bell pepper
  grill the orange bell pepper
  slice the yellow potato
  grill the yellow potato
  prepare meal
